product.title: Dumbo | Disney Book Club by Early Moments
product.text:
Dumbo

When the stork brings Mrs. Jumbo a son, the rest of the circus animals laugh at the baby's big ears. Shunned by the rest of the circus troupe, Dumbo seemingly can't do anything right. However, the young elephant has a hidden ability—he can fly. After his first performance, Dumbo becomes the star of the show. The heartwarming tale will show children that every one of us—even elephants with big ears—has something to offer.

Tie-in Activity: Dumbo has big elephant ears, and so can your child! All you need is construction paper, scissors and a stapler. Cut out a two-inch band of construction paper that fits around your child's head. Tape the ends together. Or, use a child's headband. Next, cut out a set of big Dumbo ears and staple or tape them to the band.

If your child has toy animals, line them up in a row and ask your child which ones might be part of a real circus. Have them use the book as a guide.
